name: Don Toliver
description:
'''Caleb Zackery''' "'''Don'''" '''Toliver''' ({{IPAc-en|ˈ|t|ɒ|l|ɪ|v|ə|r}} {{respell|TOL|iv|ər}}; born June 12, 1994) is an American rapper, singer, and songwriter. His debut mixtape, ''Donny Womack'' (2018) was released a day prior to fellow Houston rapper [[Travis Scott]]'s album ''[[Astroworld (album)|Astroworld]]'' (2018), on which Toliver guest appeared on its song "[[Can't Say]]". In the following week, he signed with Scott's record label, [[Cactus Jack Records]], in a joint venture with [[Atlantic Records]]. 

As a lead artist, he gained wider recognition for his 2019 single, "[[No Idea (song)|No Idea]]" and his 2020 single "[[After Party (Don Toliver song)|After Party]]", both of which entered the [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]] and received [[RIAA certification|triple platinum]] certifications by the [[Recording Industry Association of America]] (RIAA). Both songs first gained viral popularity on the video-hosting service [[TikTok]], and preceded his debut studio album, ''[[Heaven or Hell (album)|Heaven or Hell]]'' (2020). Met with favorable critical reception, it peaked within the top ten of the [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]] along with his second and third albums, ''[[Life of a Don]]'' (2021) and ''[[Love Sick (album)|Love Sick]]'' (2023). He guest appeared alongside [[Nav (rapper)|Nav]] and [[Gunna (rapper)|Gunna]] on [[Internet Money]]'s 2020 single "[[Lemonade (Internet Money and Gunna song)|Lemonade]]", which peaked within the top ten of the ''Billboard'' Hot 100. His [[trap music|trap]]-centered fourth studio album, ''[[Hardstone Psycho]]'' (2024) peaked at number three on the ''Billboard'' 200 and was led by the top 40 single, "[[Bandit (Don Toliver song)|Bandit]]".
